cbml:caption.p:
Cuando nuestros ancestros españoles arribaron al
continente, no vinieron solos, con ellos vinieron sus
dioses y sus ejércitos de ángeles armados.

Para nuestros ancestros indios los ángeles no fueron los
actuales vendedores de incienso, fueron los emisarios de la
destrucción. Entre la espada de Cortés y la de San Miguel
Arcángel no existía ninguna diferencia, y ninguna de las dos cortó
de tajo las raíces. Los brujos resistieron. Los nahuales, los brujos
más poderosos, se dieron a la tarea de combatir a los ángeles
invasores.

Los refuerzos en la tierra no se hicieron esperar, la Santa
Inquisición cerró filas con los arcángeles en la persecución de
los nahuales, eliminando a los más peligrosos, mezclándose con los
hábiles, aislando a los reacios.

Los hijos de los nahuales, los mestizos, perdieron la memoria,
empobreciendo la grandeza de sus dones.

Los cazadores de ángeles son los descendientes de aquellos
poderosos nahuales y poseen latentes los dones que les
permiten tocar a los dioses y sus emisarios, pero a veces ellos mismos
no saben que tales dones existen, mucho menos la dimensión
de estos prodigios.

OPERACIÓN BOLÍVAR es el primer relato sobre los cazadores
de ángeles y sus complejas relaciones con los hijos de los dioses
y los hijos de los hombres. Cada una de las piezas de este
ajedrez tiene pasado, presente y un futuro: LA RECUPERACIÓN
DE LA CONCIENCIA.

Algunos no soportan el trabajo
Y se vuelven locos…

Pero un cazador de ángeles
nació sólo para esto.
Somos seres marcados…

a nuestro destino…
cbml:panel.note: Frontal shot of narrator walking on the street, carrying the angel's head in his left hand, and other parts of the body and the wings in a bag saddled on his right shoulder.

cbml:panel.cbml:caption:
PESE A LO QUE DICE
LA IGLESIA, LOS ÁNGELES
NO SON DEL TODO
ETÉREOS. LIGEROS, SÍ,
PERO NO
ETÉREOS.
ESTÁN HECHOS DE MATERIA
DIVINA, AL PARECER BASTANTE
DESCONOCIDA AÚN POR
LA CIENCIA. EN ELLO RADICA
PARTE DE UN BUEN NEGOCIO… Illustration showing the proportions of the body of an angel, resembling similar drawing by DaVinci: "L'Uomo Vitruviano."

cbml:caption.p:
HUBO UN TIEMPO
EN QUE SE VENDIERON
ÓRGANOS ANGELICALES A
LABORATORIOS DE INVESTIGACIÓN
GENÉTICA.

Nadie sabe lo que descubrieron, pero,
desde entonces, la CIA y la NASA
no han dejado de perseguirnos.

cbml:caption.p:
LOS OJOS SE VENDEN A
LOS JAPONESES.

Utilizan las córneas y
cristalinos como lente
en el desarrollo de
rayos láser, además de los
intentos por dar visión
a robots dotándolos con
globos oculares completos.

cbml:panel.note: Rectangle contains text caption and anatomical illustrations of three different eye globes. A fourth eye is seen at the bottom right of the rectangle. The same angel from the introduction page stands guard atop the rectangle.

cbml:caption.p:
EL CABELLO ES SEDOSO Y
FUERTE. Con él se tejen lazos:
recios como el acero, dóciles
como el algodón: “Cable ligero”, le
llamaron algunos
ingenieros de
la General Dynamics.

cbml:panel.note: Panel is separated from the 1st one not by a gutter but by triangular dots. Below the text, there is an illustration of a set of hair and three different models of cables or ropes made from hair.

div.note: Whole page simulates being printed on parchment, Looks aged and perhaps old.

cbml:caption.p:
EL CABELLO TAMBIÉN ES
APRECIADO POR LOS VIOLINISTAS.
Cabello de ángel en un
Stradivarius es en verdad
“música del cielo”…

Paganini jamás le vendió su
alma al Diablo, pero el Diablo
sí se quedó con su alma.

cbml:panel.note: Framed portrait (of Paganini?) separates both paragraphs. Frame is baroque in style, and has a few angels.

cbml:caption.p:
Así como EL CABELLO ES
ADQUIRIDO POR MÚSICOS,
LAS PLUMAS SON ADQUIRIDAS
POR ESCRITORES. A cambio les
pedimos el alma, que luego
revendemos al Diablo; he allí
la ganancia.

El precio puede parecer
alto, pero una pluma de
éstas garantiza la genialidad, o por lo menos:
El Premio Nobel.

cbml:panel.note: Above the paragraphs, a hand holds a quill and writes.

cbml:caption.p:
PERO EL VERDADERO PREMIO ES LA CAPTURA
DE ARMAS CELESTIALES.

Según dicen, están hechas
de un superconductor
muy resistente. Hay empresas que incluso
ofrecen recompensa por un
arma de éstas, pues quien
logre reproducir este
material tendrá el
dominio de
la industria del futuro, la
Piedra Filosofal del siglo XXI.

Con una cosa así, cual-
quiera sale de pobre…
cbml:caption.note: A sword acts as a gutter, dividing the two columns of text. Below the first column, there is a dagger, and above the right one there is a helmet. All three items are labeled accordingly.

cbml:caption.p:
Pero mientras no tenga una
espada de arcángel, o algo así,
tendré que conformarme con
ser un mero carnicero.
cbml:caption.note: Narrator works in a space resembling a kitchen. There are several buckets filled with angel body parts on top of two tables. There are also several knives and a pair of tweezers or pliers. Narrator holds a big square knife and uses it to vut hands on top of a cutting board made from tree trunk. Other body parts hang from the ceiling. A light bulb above his head provides the lighting and also reminds one of the light bulb in Piccasso's "Guernika".

cbml:caption.p:
No sé para qué puedan
servir las uñas. Son de un
material flexible y resistente,
como si fuera plástico antibalas.
Algún día me haré un chaleco con
las que llevo reunidas.

cbml:caption.p:
LA SANGRE SE BEBE, Y SUS
USOS SON MÚLTIPLES.
FERMENTADA CON MAÍZ Y
DESTILADA, SE OBTIENE “CHÍNGUERE”,
UN AGUARDIENTE FUERTE Y
AROMÁTICO.

cbml:caption.p:
La carne se come.
Tiene espectaculares
propiedades tonificantes
y medicinales.
cbml:caption.note: Two arms at work slice meat skillfully on a cutting board. A stack of cut slices appear on the left.

cbml:caption.p:
DEL SEMEN DE ÁNGEL SE
DICEN MILAGROS, Y HAY
QUIEN OFRECE FORTUNAS POR
UNAS CUANTAS GOTAS… EL
PROBLEMA ES QUE NADIE HA
PODIDO MASTURBAR A UN ÁNGEL.

cbml:caption.p:
Aunque
sin duda …

… lo que más
vende son los
huesos molidos,
que resultan
ser la droga
más potente
que haya yo
conocido.

Vender ángeles puede

Pero es lo único

cbml:panel.cbml:caption:
Por la noche, Román
ya tiene una confesión
firmada donde el
ángel se declara
extraterrestre…

También ha dicho dónde
aterrizarán sus… ¿OVNIS?

body.p:
Yo, el Angel guardián
B-4162360, confieso
ante Dios y ante vosotros
hermanos que mi naturaleza es
extraterrestre en palabra, obra
y circunstancia.

Ruego a Sta. María siempre
virgen a los ángeles y a los
santos para que intercedan por
mí ante la Gran Institución.

a la Catedral de Angelópolis.

Jaime

Román viene

Ángeles del Cielo cuidando
armas terrenales. El asunto
huele mal, muy mal.

Por la madrugada, el viaje termina

div.p:
Desaparecer de golpe la industria de guerra significa
desaparecer al Imperio Gringo.

Terminada la Guerra Fría, el aparato militar resulta
costoso, enorme e injustificado. Pero hay contratos
millonarios incancelables y el AH-1521 es el cumplimiento a un pedido de helicóptero de combate
antirradar para usarse en la guerra antinarco,
represión de movimientos étnicos armados e
intervenciones fuera y dentro de USA que requieran
operatividad bajo cualquier circunstancia con
armamento de alta selectividad.

Sus sistemas de visión pueden incluso detectar
ángeles, aunque, para matarlos, aún se requiere que la
mano de un cazador actúe.

Conocer sus caminos podría
salvar de calamidades.
cbml:panel.note: Large panel is a WS showing narrator trudging through the waters in the interior of the underground paths. Front and center we can see a statue of La Coatlicue. There's also a variety of pre-Hispanic and colonial ruins, creatures that look like flying dinosaurs, etc.
Panel is a surface-level view showing narrator's hand as he pushes a manhole cover aside.
Panel is a surface-level view showing narrator's upper body as he pushes himself up through manhole.
Surface-level CU view of narrator's upper body as he pushes himself up through manhole.

cbml:panel.cbml:caption: ¡SANGRE!
cbml:panel.note: Surface-level view of narrator's upper body as he notices river of blood advancing toward him.
Surface-level view of narrator's upper body as he stretches out his hand to touch the river of blood advancing toward him.

cbml:panel.cbml:caption:
¿Por qué hay tanta
sangre en el asfalto?
cbml:panel.note: Surface-level view of narrator's upper body from behind. His right hand is stained with blood.

cbml:panel.cbml:caption:
Sigo el
rastro…
cbml:panel.note: WS shows narrator kneeling behind a corner where there is a library. Something on the opposite side of the street is encircled in white triangles and seems to be the origin of the river of blood.

div.note: Panels 1-6 are smaller, rectangular, and are framed in white border. They occupy approximately 1/2 of page, with image on panel #7 occupying lower half.

cbml:panel.cbml:caption:
Mala seña:
el rastro me
lleva hasta…

…y hasta Juan Grande
que riega y riega sangre
tirado en el asfalto…

…asfalto que devora
hombres pero no bebe
sangre porque de sangres
no sabe…
¡OH, INÚTIL SACRIFICIO!
ALABADO SEA DIOS
cbml:panel.note: Large panel shows entrance to a bar (saloon-style). Front walls are littered with ads and posters for boxing and other events. A skinny, pregnant bitch walsks across the sidewalk. Juan Grande is lying on the street and is missing his hands. His body is boxed inside white lines and dots.
WS shows Don Juan lying on the street, occupying forefront of panel. Narrator runs toward him from the background.

cbml:panel.cbml:caption:
No se qué hacer.
Don Juan Grande
se muere y no se
me ocurre otra cosa
mas que…
cbml:panel.note: WS shows narrator holding Don Juan in arms and walking through the saloon-style doors of the bar. A sign behind him and above a mettal door has an image of St. Anthony of Padua. Lettering and style on the sign make it seem like a colonial image
MCU shows narrator yelling while Don Juan's head rests on his shoulder.
MCU shows Protector's right hand pointing a mini machine gun at narrator's head.

div.note: Panel #2 is the largest, and occupies centaral spot on page. Panels 1, 3 and 4 are horizontal and approximately the same size, 1/2 height of #2. Panels 1 and 2 are darker, while #3 and #4 seem to be overexposed.

cbml:panel.cbml:caption:
NÓTESE las osadas
intenciones
de nuestro
protagonista.
cbml:panel.note: WS shows Protector standing tall in front of narrator and Don Juan, who are at the floor level. Protector is pointing a gun at them with his right hand, while holding a "poor devil" by the neck with his left. This character may be the bartender, but it's not clear. In any case, his face resembles that of a devil, as does the hooves at the end of his legs and the tail coming out of the back of his pants. He has black wings. Narrator is holding Don Juan's head up with his left hand, while reaching for a gun with his right. This is indicated by the caption and also by an arrow coming out of it and pointing to a white circle in the image where his hand is.

cbml:panel.cbml:caption:
Intento
madrugarlo
cbml:panel.note: MCU shows narrator rapidly drawing his gun and trying to knock Protector's gun off his right hand.

div.note: Panel #1 is the largest, and occupies most of the page. Panel 2 is much smaller and is superimposed to #1 on bottom right.

cbml:panel.cbml:caption: pero…
cbml:panel.note: CU shows Protector's boot kicking the gun off narrator's hand.
CU shows Protector's fist punching narrator in the face.
CU shows Protector's hand holding a knife up in the air.
MCU shows narrator on the floor attempting to reach his gun with his right hand.
MCU shows Protector's foot stepping on narrator's arm and his gloved hand holding narrator's hand on the floor, and preventing him from reaching his gun.

cbml:panel.cbml:caption:
el madrugado
es otro…
cbml:panel.note: WS shows Protector holding narrator down on the floor with his foot and hand, while he holds up the knife with his right hand and gets ready to strike. Juan Grande lies on the floor to the right of the panel and seems to be evaporating or disintegrating. Poor devil is seen in upper right hand side, toward the back, holding his neck with his right hand and using his left as support on the floor.

div.note: Panel #6 is the largest, and occupies most of the page. Panels #1 to #3 are much smaller and square shaped. Panels #4 and 5 are located below them and are rectangular. Height of both of these together is about height of each of the former, while length of each #4 and 5 is same as that of #1 to #3 combined. These 5 panels are boxed in by a white border and are superposed to top part of #6.

cbml:panel.cbml:caption:
…para suerte mía
aparece de metiche
…el angel Zofiel
cbml:panel.note: CU of a hand reaching for narrator's gun.
MCU shows Zofiel shooting at Protector.
CU of bullet and Protector's hand holding a knife up in the air.

cbml:panel.cbml:caption: Y como entre ángeles no se pueden matar…
cbml:panel.note: WS shows both angels poised and ready to shoot.
CU of hands holding guns shooting at each other.

cbml:panel.cbml:caption: …el ángel inicuo (al que se le acaba el parque) decide huir.
cbml:panel.note: CU shows tip of Protector's wings as he flees out of the panel to the left, while hand on right of panel keeps shooting.

div.note: Panel #4 is the largest, and occupies about 1/2 of the page. Panels #1 to #3 are much smaller and square shaped. Panels #4 and 5 are located below them and are rectangular. Height of both of these together is about height of each of the former, while length of each #4 and 5 is same as that of #1 to #3 combined.

cbml:panel.note: WS shows Zofiel chasing Protector flying through the streets.
CU of Zofiel's head on left side of panel. Narrator is on his knees on the right.

cbml:panel.cbml:caption:
Entonces Zofiel, con fuegos
del Cielo y el Infierno cauteriza
las heridas de Juan Grande.
cbml:panel.note: WS shows Zofiel holding his hands over Don Juan and healing his wounds.

div.note: Panel #1 is the largest, and occupies the entire page. Panels #2 to #3 are smaller and superposed to the right of #1.

cbml:panel.cbml:caption:
Llevamos a
Juan Grande
a mi casa…
Image inside caption shows a birdcage.

Le damos carne de
ángel para reponerse…
Image inside caption shows meat.

…y chínguere
para
reanimarse…
Image inside caption shows a bottle and a glass.

…y le hago
lugar junto a
mi cama…
Image inside caption shows a bed.
cbml:panel.note: WS shows Zofiel following narrator through the door and into the house. Juan Grande is being carried in arms by narrator.

cbml:panel.cbml:caption:
…en un
petate.

Al fin que ya ha de
estar acostumbrado.
cbml:panel.note: WS shows narrator helping Don Juan onto a rug on the floor.

cbml:panel.cbml:caption:
Mientras, trato de
restablecerme un poco…
cbml:panel.note: MCU shows narrator's head under the shower.

cbml:panel.cbml:caption:
…y Zofiel husmea
por la casa.
cbml:panel.note: MCU shows Zofiel holding something in his right hand.

div.note: Panel #1 is the largest, and occupies 1/2 of the page. Panels #2 to #4 are smaller and located in bottom half of page.

cbml:panel.note: MCU shows Zofiel showing a jug to narrator while the latter dries off with a towel.
MCU shows Zofiel turning away from narrator to examine the jug while the latter gets a shirt on.
MCU shows Zofiel facing narrator with the jug while the latter takes it away from him.
MCU shows Zofiel lighting a cigarrette.

cbml:panel.cbml:balloon:
No sé:
Creo que
por la
Catedral.
cbml:panel.note: WS shows Zofiel smoking his cigarrette while narrator gets his gun ready. There is an image of Virgin of Guadalupe on the right of frame and a belt with bullets and some mechanical tools on a table in the forefront.

div.note: Panel #5 is the largest, and occupies most of the page. Panels #1 to #3 are smaller and superposed to the right of the frame from top to bottom. Panel #4 is located in bottom left of page and is larger than #s 1 to 3.

cbml:panel.note: WS shows Zofiel and narrator looking startled at the door. Narrator holds his gun up in the air at a draw, and Zofiel seems to be reaching for his inside his overcoat.
MCU shows Zofiel about to open the door, with hun held up over his head.
MCU shows Zofiel at the door staring at naked body of Roman lying below.

cbml:panel.cbml:balloon:
Ya no
tienes que ir
a buscarlo.
cbml:panel.note: MCU shows Zofiel holding gun with left hand and grabbbing his trenchcoat with his right.

cbml:panel.cbml:caption:
Román está
maltrecho.

le doy carne de ángel
para reponerse…
Image inside caption shows meat.

…chínguere
para reanimarse.
Image inside caption shows a bottle and a glass.

…polvo para
levantarse…
Image inside caption shows a skull and bones.
cbml:panel.note: WS shows naked and tortured bocy of Roman amidst a series of ornaments and signs.

div.note: Panels # 1 and #5 are larger, and located at top and bottom of page. Panels #2 to #4 are smaller and superposed between 1 and 5, framed in white border.

cbml:panel.cbml:caption:
…y le doy lugar
en el sofá.
Image inside caption shows a sofa.

figure.figDesc: Pre-Hispanic representation for speech comes out of Roman's mouth.

cbml:panel.cbml:caption: Y cuenta lo sucedido.
cbml:panel.note: WS shows Zofiel and narrator standing at both sides of Roman, who has beeen wrapped in a blanket and is sitting on the couch. Characters resemble representations from codices, including the symbol representing Roman's speech. There is a picture on the wall right above Roman's head that looks like an Escher roller coaster with ants instead of cars. To the right of the frame there is another picture on the wall that reads "La Trevi 2000" and seems to be a pin-up poster of singer Gloria Trevi. One more, on the left side of panel, looks like a colonial religious image, and may be the picture of the Virgin of Guadalupe that was shown before. To the right, next to narrator and below the Trevi poster there is a table with barroque decorations. On the table there are tools and remnants of bodies, possibly belonging to angels.

cbml:panel.cbml:balloon:
A Juan le roban las
manos, a Román casi
y a ti también…
Les están dando
recio, ¿eh?
cbml:panel.note: MCU shows Zofiel holding something in his hands as he speaks. Image in the background seems to be a page from a Latin-language text.
MCU shows narrator sitting in a medidative posture.
MCU shows narrator glancing up at Zofiel from his chair.

cbml:panel.cbml:balloon:
Regálame el
alma que
tienes allí…
cbml:panel.note: MCU shows Zofiel holding his right hand to his chin.

div.note: Panels # 1 and #2 are larger. Panels #3 to #4 are smaller and superposed on the bottom of #2, and framed in white border.

cbml:panel.cbml:caption: ¡HECHO!

Zofiel es
EL HERALDO DEL INFIERNO
En realidad es un espía
doble; así que sabe más de
lo que aparenta
cbml:panel.cbml:balloon:
El Arcángel Miguel
está muy corrompido.
Ahora anda en
negocios muy sucios.

Está coludido con
ejércitos y policías de
Latinoamerica, y con un
gringo de la CIA que
tiene el don de
matar ángeles.
cbml:panel.note: WS shows Zofiel holding the jug in his left hand as he speaks and gestures with his right. An angel seems to stem from his wing on the upper left corner, while we can see his hooves at the end of his legs and a tail coming out from under his trenchcoat.

cbml:panel.cbml:balloon:
¡Ah, caray!
Creí que ese don
era solo en hijos
de indio.
cbml:panel.note: MCU shows narrator looking up toward Zofiel and holding his right hand open as he speaks.

cbml:panel.cbml:balloon:
Pues ya ves;
y es el gringo el
que manda. Ahora
están planeando
una matanza de
ángeles.

Esto es
en el rancho
del gringo.
cbml:panel.note: MCU shows Zofiel's upper torso and the gestures he's making with his hands as he speaks.

div.note: Panel # 1 is larger and occupies approximately 2/3 of page. Panels #2 and #3 are smaller, and framed in white border. They are superposed on image of page from book (in Latin?) at the bottom of the page

cbml:panel.cbml:balloon:
¿Y dónde
queda eso?
Tenemos que
hablar con ese
gringo.
cbml:panel.note: MCU shows narrator glancing up at Zofiel as he speaks.
CU shows Zofiel's head as he holds out a cover of TIME magazine with an image of the Virgin of Guadalupe.

div.head: America The Paradise
div.ab: LA If you’re traveling to the United States,

cbml:panel.note: CU of magazine advertisement, probably center-fold, shows NYC with Statue of Liberty and Twin Towers at center, while a blonde woman in a bikini is at the forefront, on righ of right-hand page.

cbml:panel.cbml:caption: Zofiel nos traza un mapa

figure.figDesc: A hand-drawn map showing a path (indicated by a dotted line) through the border line and the Rio Grande, through a group of buildings, and to an "x" near some mountains.

cbml:panel.note: CU of Zofiel's hand drawing a map on a piece of paper.

cbml:panel.cbml:caption:
No quiere acompañarnos, pero accede
a cuidar a Juan Grande mientras
incursionamos a EL PARAÍSO.
cbml:panel.note: WS shows Protector in bottom left corner of frame looking through a pair of binoculars. Narrator and Roman appear as small white figures departing from the building, while Zofiel, also a white figure, seems to wave good-bye from the entrance. The floor/street is covered by what appears to be text from a Latin book.

div.note: Panel #5 is the largest, and is located at bottom of page. Panels #1 to #4 are smaller and are superposed on top half of page, all framed in white border, except for #3. Panel #3 is magazine image brought forth by Zofiel's hand.
